title: Early Gastric Cancer: A Demonstrative Case Report
patient: A 71-year-old male patient was admitted to hospital with complaints of fatigue. His physical examination was normal, except pale oral and scleral mucosa. Laboratory examination revealed that hemoglobin level was 10.4 gm/dl and ferritin was 4.9 mg/dl. Biochemical tests were normal. For determining the etiology of the iron deficiency anemia, upper gastrointestinal endoscopy was done. A 5 mm erythematous area was seen in the cardia (). Biopsy was obtained from the lesion. Histopathological examination showed well-differentiated adenocarcinoma from biopsy material.
